intro: Gleasonia duidana, commonly known as the Duidana pohutukawa, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, clustered inflorescences of bright red or orange flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a leathery texture. Gleasonia duidana is well adapted to coastal environments and is often found in sandy soils along the New Zealand coastline.
